meanings.definition: Holding someone's attention as though they are under a spell.
meanings.sent1: The magician's performance was truly spellbinding.
meanings.sent2: The movie had a spellbinding effect on the audience.
meanings.sent3: The cat's ability to catch the laser pointer was almost spellbinding.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky in a spellbinding array of colors.
meanings.sent5: The singer's voice was so spellbinding that it brought tears to my eyes.

meanings.sent1: The book's plot was so spellbinding that I couldn't put it down.
meanings.sent2: The dance performance was truly spellbinding to watch.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's antics were spellbinding, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The city lights at night created a spellbinding view from the hilltop.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes created a spellbinding masterpiece on the canvas.

meanings.definition: Having the power to charm or fascinate.
meanings.sent1: Her smile was so spellbinding that it lit up the room.
meanings.sent2: The storyteller had a spellbinding way of keeping the children engaged.
meanings.sent3: The little girl's dance recital was spellbinding, even with her mistakes.
meanings.sent4: The old watch had a spellbinding history of being passed down through generations.
meanings.sent5: The garden had a spellbinding fragrance that lingered in the air.
